text: we have been doing interrogations
interrogating bad guys terrorists for
hundreds of years our strategy need to
be totally in sync with our laws and if
it's not in sync with our laws then
you're going to have a problem and that
a problem can be deadly enhanced
interrogation techniques were legalized
by memos from the office of the legal
counsel when the Attorney General
declassified the office of legal
counsels memos there was a storm there
were many articles many politicians many
media outlets going out and basically
saying look you know yeah there was
something that was done in his
interrogation techniques but without the
enhanced interrogation techniques we
will never know KSM was the mastermind
of 911 will never get idea the so-called
dirty bummer we won't know the location
of from savini shape that was all not
true and I was involved with many other
CIA officers and another FBI agent in
getting this information and we got it
way before enhanced interrogation
techniques were even authorized the
editorial came out to put the truth out
and to end seven years of silence
regarding the claimed efficacy of EITS
one of the best interrogations and the
war on terror according to the US
government was an interrogation where we
read the subject has Miranda rights
every day the traditional interrogation
is not about to just go in and being
nice to the bad guy no not at all the
traditional interrogation is based on
knowledge you have to know everything
about that individual you're
interrogating and when you know a lot
about him or when he thinks that you
know a lot about him then you can play
that mental game you play that poker
game you paid you play the chess game
with Abu Zubaydah for example the very
first moment you know I asked him what's
his name and he gave me an alias so I
asked him what if I call you honey and
that actually shook him to the core
because honey was the name that his
mother called him as a child so he knew
that I know everything about him so the
tactics that was utilized on Abu
Zubaydah or on the coal bombers or on
some of the people in the East Africa
embassy bombing or in the United States
or in Guantanamo Bay it's a tactic that
has been used by by interrogators law
enforcement or intelligence
interrogators or military interrogators
for the longest period of time it
guarantees that you get accurate
information and you have a safe ending
by prosecuting the individual but it's
not easy nobody said it's easy I think
it's way harder than dunking somebody in
the water you know if you are successful
with the regular interrogation with the
traditional interrogations you will gain
cooperation and there's a big difference
between cooperation and between getting
the individual to do whatever you want
him to do with cooperation you get
accurate information with cooperation
you get accurate intelligence I mean the
perfect example is even check a living
even shkolu be ones through a form of
enhanced interrogation techniques at the
end he gave information regarding the
relationship between iraq and al-qaeda
and the development of WMD by Saddam
Hussein's regime that information was
used in the UN by the United States to
generate international support for the
war in Iraq when we went to Iraq we
found out first that there's no
connection between Iraq and between
al-qaeda and second there's no WMDs they
went back to even shake and they asked
him why did you provide this information
why did you lie and he said well that's
what you wanted to hear
